intro: Senecio pulchellus, commonly known as the showy senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio pulchellus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
